headline.main: NEWS FROM ARKANSAS.; The Rebel Forces Concentrating in the Northwestern Part of the State Illness of Gen. Sigel, & C.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is reported that the rebels have withdrawn their forces from Northwestern Arkansas, and concentrating them at Pocahontas, in the northeastern part of that State. Their force at that point is represented to be 10,000. The National forces, under Gen. STEELE, are between Greenville, Mo., and the Arkansas line, prepared to meet any movement the rebels may make.

headline.main: NEWS FROM WASHINGTON.; Bulletin from the War Department. Acknowledgment of Offers of Assistance for the Wounded in the Great Battle.The Bill Abolishing Slavery in the District of Columbia Passed in the House. Debate on the Confiscation Bill in the Senate. WAR BULLETIN. WAR DEPARTMENT. EDWIN M. STANTON, Secretary of War NEWS FROM MANASSAS. NOMINATIONS BEFORE THE SENATE. PAY, BOUNTY AND PENSIONS. DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE THE JUDICIARY. LORD LYONS. GEN. ROSECHANS. SECRETARY CHASE ABSENT. TRANSPORTS TO BE DISCHARGED. CASSIUS M. CLAY CONFIRMED AS A MAJOR-GENERAL COL. PATTERSON A BRIGADIER ORDERS TO ACTING MASTERS THE FEMALE REBELS. CALIFORNIA MATTERS.

docs.snippet: In the Senate, yesterday, a bill to increase the duty on salt having been reported, a motion was made to recommit it, with instructions to the Committee to sit during the recess, to consider wheather it is possible to enact a law to increase the...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the Senate, yesterday, a bill to increase the duty on salt having been reported, a motion was made to recommit it, with instructions to the Committee to sit during the recess, to consider wheather it is possible to enact a law to increase the revenue from salt.

docs.snippet: Mr. CYRUS W. FIELD has returned home in the Asia His mission to Europe, as is well known, had reference to the resuscitation of the Atlantic Telegraph.

headline.main: THE ATLANTIC TELEGRAPH.; Return of Mr. Cyrus W. Field Prospects of the Enterprise New Plans An Important Conference on the Subject Remarks of Mr. Adams, the American Minister.

docs.abstract: Plans to complete cable being weighed, Europe
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. CYRUS W. FIELD has returned home in the Asia His mission to Europe, as is well known, had reference to the resuscitation of the Atlantic Telegraph.

docs.snippet: We beg the Tribune to reconsider its demand upon the Senate to substitute the Mayors of New-York and Brooklyn for the two Police Commissioners who are made members of the Board of Health by the bill now pending in the Legislature.
docs.lead_paragraph: We beg the Tribune to reconsider its demand upon the Senate to substitute the Mayors of New-York and Brooklyn for the two Police Commissioners who are made members of the Board of Health by the bill now pending in the Legislature.

headline.main: THE BLOCKADING SERVICE.; OUR KEY WEST CORRESPONDENCE MORE PRIZES WITH COTTON STORIES OF REFUGEES BURNING OF A REBEL STEAMER A WRECK VESSELS IN PORT.

docs.abstract: Report from blockading service off Florida
docs.lead_paragraph: The gunboat steamer I.P. Jackson, Capt WOODWORTH, of the mortar fleet, arrived on March , from Baltimore, which port she left on the 14th. She has encountered much rough weather, but sustained no injury, and will at once take coals on board and proceed to the Mississippi, where we trust they will make heir first demonstration.

docs.snippet: The President has issued a proclamation recom  mending the people of the United States, on the next day of worship occuring after its reception, to give thanks to Almighty God for the recent vic  tories, and to implore spiritual consolation for those...
docs.lead_paragraph: The President has issued a proclamation recom mending the people of the United States, on the next day of worship occuring after its reception, to give thanks to Almighty God for the recent vic tories, and to implore spiritual consolation for those who have been brought into affliction by the casualties and calamities of sedition and civil war.
